Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We need to examine each case for deviations from typical P2P flow: standard order: Create Requisition -> Approve Requisition -> Issue PO -> Receive Goods -> Vendor Invoice Received -> Match Invoice to PO (three-way match) -> Release Payment -> Close Case. Some variations allowed: invoice may arrive before goods (but then must be matched after goods). Also approval must happen before PO issuance. Payment should not be before goods receipt and invoice match.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1001: follows correct order. No anomaly.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1002: Sequence: Create Requisition, Issue PO (without approval), then Invoice Received, Release Payment, then Approve Requisition, then Receive Goods, then Match Invoice to PO, then Close. Issues: PO issued before requisition approval (violates control). Payment released before goods receipt and before matching invoice to PO. Also approval after payment is odd. So multiple anomalies.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1003: Sequence: Create, Approve, Issue PO, then Release Payment (before invoice, before goods). Then Invoice Received after payment, then Receive Goods, then Match, then Close. Anomalies: payment before invoice and goods receipt; invoice after payment; goods receipt after payment. Also match after goods receipt but after payment already done.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1004: Sequence: Create, Approve, Receive Goods, Issue PO (goods before PO), then Invoice Received, Match, Release Payment, Close. Anomalies: receiving goods before PO issuance (breaks control, could be unauthorized purchase). Also PO after goods may cause mismatches.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Also note timestamps: In case 1004, Receive Goods at 09:00, Issue PO at 09:15 same day, close next day. So goods before PO.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Potential other anomalies: In case 1002, invoice received before PO issuance? Actually PO issued before invoice, but approval missing. Also invoice received before goods receipt (common but okay). However payment before goods receipt is problematic.
